TEXT.P: A spring snowstorm has dumped up to 2 feet (60 centimeters) of heavy, wet snow on parts of the northeastern U.S., cutting off power to thousands and closing some schools.

National Weather Service meteorologist Brooke Taber says record snowfalls were reported Tuesday and Wednesday at the Burlington International Airport in Vermont. The snow is expected to end late Wednesday.
Utilities say about 30,000 customers are without power in Vermont and New York state. Scattered outages have been reported in New Hampshire.

Large storms so late in the season are rare. Mark Breen, a meteorologist at the Fairbanks Museum and Planetarium in St. Johnsbury, says 22 inches (56 centimeters) of snow was reported in Malone, New York, on April 23, 1993, and 24 inches (61 centimeters) in Bellows Falls, Vermont, on April 27, 1874.
